docs.title: Konva
docs.description: Classes

docs.title: Konva.Animation
docs.description: Animation constructor.

docs.title: Konva.Arc
docs.description: Arc constructor

docs.title: Konva.Arrow
docs.description: Arrow constructor

docs.title: Konva.Canvas
docs.description: Canvas Renderer constructor. It is a wrapper around native canvas element. Usually you don't need to use it manually.

docs.title: Konva.Circle
docs.description: Circle constructor

docs.title: Konva.Container
docs.description: Container constructor.  Containers are used to contain nodes or other containers

docs.title: Konva.Context
docs.description: Konva wrapper around native 2d canvas context. It has almost the same API of 2d context with some additional functions. With core Konva shapes you don't need to use this object. But you will use it if you want to create a custom shape or a custom hit regions. For full information about each 2d context API use MDN documentation

docs.title: Konva.Easings
docs.description: Own Methods

docs.title: Konva.Ellipse
docs.description: Ellipse constructor

docs.title: Konva.FastLayer
docs.description: FastLayer constructor. DEPRECATED! Please use Konva.Layer(\{ listening: false\}) instead. Layers are tied to their own canvas element and are used to contain shapes only.  If you don't need node nesting, mouse and touch interactions, or event pub/sub, you should use FastLayer instead of Layer to create your layers. It renders about 2x faster than normal layers.

docs.title: Konva.Filters
docs.description: Own Methods

docs.title: Konva.Group
docs.description: Group constructor.  Groups are used to contain shapes or other groups.

docs.title: Konva.Image
docs.description: Image constructor

docs.title: Konva.Label
docs.description: Label constructor.  Labels are groups that contain a Text and Tag shape

docs.title: Konva.Layer
docs.description: Layer constructor.  Layers are tied to their own canvas element and are used to contain groups or shapes.

docs.title: Konva.Line
docs.description: Line constructor.  Lines are defined by an array of points and  a tension

docs.title: Konva.Node
docs.description: Node constructor. Nodes are entities that can be transformed, layered, and have bound events. The stage, layers, groups, and shapes all extend Node.

docs.title: Konva.Path
docs.description: Path constructor.

docs.title: Konva.Rect
docs.description: Rect constructor

docs.title: Konva.RegularPolygon
docs.description: RegularPolygon constructor. Examples include triangles, squares, pentagons, hexagons, etc.

docs.title: Konva.Ring
docs.description: Ring constructor

docs.title: Konva.Shape
docs.description: Shape constructor.  Shapes are primitive objects such as rectangles,  circles, text, lines, etc.

docs.title: Konva.Sprite
docs.description: Sprite constructor

docs.title: Konva.Stage
docs.description: Stage constructor.  A stage is used to contain multiple layers

docs.title: Konva.Star
docs.description: Star constructor

docs.title: Konva.Tag
docs.description: Tag constructor.  A Tag can be configured  to have a pointer element that points up, right, down, or left

docs.title: Konva.Text
docs.description: Text constructor

docs.title: Konva.TextPath
docs.description: Path constructor.

docs.title: Konva.Transform
docs.description: Transform constructor. In most of the cases you don't need to use it in your app. Because it is for internal usage in Konva core. But there is a documentation for that class in case you still want to make some manual calculations.

docs.title: Konva.Transformer
docs.description: Transformer constructor.  Transformer is a special type of group that allow you transform Konva primitives and shapes. Transforming tool is not changing width and height properties of nodes when you resize them. Instead it changes scaleX and scaleY properties.

docs.title: Konva.Tween
docs.description: Tween constructor.  Tweens enable you to animate a node between the current state and a new state.  You can play, pause, reverse, seek, reset, and finish tweens.  By default, tweens are animated using  a linear easing.  For more tweening options, check out Konva.Easings

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Select Shape by Name Tutorial
docs.description: To select shapes by name with Konva, we can use the find() method using the . selector.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Select Shape by Name Tutorial

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Select Shape by Type Tutorial
docs.description: To select shapes by type with Konva, we can use the find() method with the name of the type or class name.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Select Shape by Type Tutorial

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Arc Tutorial
docs.description: To create an arc shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Arc() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Arrow Tutorial
docs.description: To create an arrow shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Arrow() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Circle Tutorial
docs.description: To create a circle shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Circle() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Custom Shape Tutorial
docs.description: To create a custom shape with Konva, you can use the Konva.Shape() object and define a custom drawing function.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Ellipse Tutorial
docs.description: To create an ellipse shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Ellipse() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Group Tutorial
docs.description: To create a group of shapes with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Group() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Image Tutorial
docs.description: To create an image with Konva, you can use the Konva.Image() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Label Tutorial
docs.description: To create a label with Konva, you can use the Konva.Label() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Line Tutorial
docs.description: To create line shapes with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Line() object. Lines can be configured in different ways to create various shapes like simple lines, splines, blobs, and polygons.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Blob Tutorial
docs.description: To create a blob with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Line() object with both closed and tension properties.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Polygon Tutorial
docs.description: To create a polygon with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Line() object with the closed property set to true.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Line Tutorial
docs.description: To create a simple line with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Line() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Spline Tutorial
docs.description: To create a spline (curved line) with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Line() object with the tension property.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Path Tutorial
docs.description: To create a custom path shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Path() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Rectangle Tutorial
docs.description: To create a rectangle with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Rect() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Regular Polygon Tutorial
docs.description: To create a regular polygon shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.RegularPolygon() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Ring Tutorial
docs.description: To create a ring with Konva, you can use the Konva.Ring() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Sprite Tutorial
docs.description: To create an animated sprite with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Sprite() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Star Tutorial
docs.description: To create a star with Konva, you can use the Konva.Star() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Text Tutorial
docs.description: To create text with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Text() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas TextPath Tutorial
docs.description: To create text that follows a path with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.TextPath() object.

docs.title: HTML5 canvas Wedge Tutorial
docs.description: To create a wedge (pie piece) shape with Konva, we can instantiate a Konva.Wedge() object.

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Blend mode with globalCompositeOperation Tutorial
docs.description: globalCompositeOperation Documentation.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Blend mode with globalCompositeOperation Tutorial

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Set Fill Tutorial
docs.description: To fill a shape with Konva, we can set the fill property when we instantiate a shape, or we can use the fill() method.

docs.title: Fill and stroke order demo
docs.description: If a shape has both fill and stroke, by default, Konva will draw filling first then stroke on top of it. That is the best behavior for most of the applications.

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Hide and Show Shape Tutorial
docs.description: To hide and show a shape with Konva, we can set the visible property when we instantiate a shape, or we can use the hide() and show() methods.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Hide and Show Shape Tutorial

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Line Join Tutorial
docs.description: To set the line join for a shape with Konva, we can set the lineJoin property when we instantiate a shape, or we can use the lineJoin() method.

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Change Mouse Cursor Style
docs.description: To change mouse cursor with Konva framework you just need to listen events, where do you need to change the cursor, and apply new styles manually for Stage container.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Change Mouse Cursor Style

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Set Shape Opacity Tutorial
docs.description: To set a shape opacity with Konva, we can set the opacity property when we instantiate the node, or we can use the opacity() method.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Set Shape Opacity Tutorial

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Shadows Tutorial
docs.description: To apply shadows with Konva, we can set the shadowColor, shadowOffset, shadowBlur, and shadowOpacity properties when we instantiate a shape.

docs.title: HTML5 Canvas Set Shape Stroke Color and Width Tutorial
docs.description: To set a shape stroke and stroke width with Konva, we can set the stroke and strokeWidth properties when we instantiate a shape, or we can use the stroke() and strokeWidth() methods.

frontMatter.title: HTML5 Canvas Set Shape Stroke Color and Width Tutorial
